benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/block - Block an account

covered: Valid payload creation with minimal data (TC01) and with all optional parameters (TC02)

Various validation and error-handling scenarios for POST (400/401/404) including invalid accountId (TC07), missing header (TC08), missing body (TC09), malformed JSON (TC10), unauthorized (TC11), account not found (TC06)
Security tests for SQL injection in accountId (TC13) and malicious payload (TC14)
Edge cases and boundaries: empty pluginProperty array (TC15), maximum field lengths (TC16), minimum values (TC17)
Account-data edge cases: no prior blocking states (TC05), account exists but no prior blocks (TC05)
Integration tests: plugin interaction (TC21) and plugin service unavailable (TC22)
Regression tests: duplicate BlockingState avoidance (TC23) and backward compatibility (TC24)
Performance and scalability tests: high concurrency (TC25) and sustained load (TC26)
gaps: 500 Internal Server Error scenario explicitly (instead of/in addition to 503) not tested
403 Forbidden / insufficient permissions beyond 401 not tested
POST payload field-type validation inside BlockingState (data types) not explicitly tested
Rate limiting / throttling behavior for bursts not explicitly tested
Caching headers validation for POST responses (ETag/Cache-Control) not applicable or not tested]
recommendations: Add a test simulating 500 Internal Server Error to cover server-side failure scenarios beyond 503
Add a 403 Forbidden test to validate proper handling when credentials are present but access is not allowed
Add tests validating BlockingState field types and data-type mismatches within the payload
Add rate-limiting tests to verify behavior under bursty POST requests
Consider an idempotency/duplicate-submission test pattern if API supports it, and document expected behavior for repeated submissions
Clarify whether caching headers apply to this POST and, if so, add tests for Cache-Control/ETag where relevant
